meanings.definition: The internal organ in which the major part of the digestion of food occurs.
meanings.sent1: Our stomachs growled loudly when we smelled the delicious food.
meanings.sent2: She felt a pain in her stomachs after eating too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The stomachs of the fridge were filled with tasty leftovers.
meanings.sent4: His hunger was a roaring beast in his stomachs.
meanings.sent5: The stomachs of the earth digest all the nutrients we provide.

meanings.definition: The front part of the body between the chest and the pelvis.
meanings.sent1: He placed his hands on his stomachs to feel the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent2: The baby's laughter made her stomachs ache from joy.
meanings.sent3: The stomachs of the clock were decorated with intricate designs.
meanings.sent4: Her stomachs tightened with nervous anticipation before the performance.
meanings.sent5: The stomachs of the mountain were covered in lush greenery.

meanings.definition: To tolerate or accept something unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: She had to stomachs the bitter taste of the medicine.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't stomachs the thought of leaving his friends behind.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were hard to stomachs, but they made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: I had to stomachs my fear and jump off the diving board.
meanings.sent5: He tried to stomachs the criticism, but it still hurt.
